1 /**
  2  * Emily
  3  * Copyright(c) 2012 Olivier Scherrer <pode.fr@gmail.com>
  4  * MIT Licensed
  5  */
  6 
  7 define("Transport", 
  8 /**
  9  * @class
 10  * Transport creates the link between your requests and Emily's requests handlers.
 11  * A request handler can be defined to make requets of any kind as long as it's supported
 12  * by your node.js. (HTTP, FileSystem, SIP...)
 13  */
 14 function Transport() {
 15 	
 16 	/**
 17 	 * Create a Transport
 18 	 * @param {Object} $reqHandlers the requestHandler defined in your node.js app
 19 	 * @returns
 20 	 */
 21 	return function TransportConstructor($reqHandlers) {
 22 		
 23 		/**
 24 		 * The request handlers
 25 		 * @private
 26 		 */
 27 		var _reqHandlers = null;
 28 		
 29 		/**
 30 		 * Set the requests handlers
 31 		 * @param {Object} reqHandlers the list of requests handlers
 32 		 * @returns
 33 		 */
 34 		this.setReqHandlers = function setReqHandlers(reqHandlers) {
 35 			if (typeof reqHandlers == "object") {
 36 				_reqHandlers = reqHandlers;
 37 				return true;
 38 			} else {
 39 				return false;
 40 			}
 41 		};
 42 		
 43 		/**
 44 		 * Get the requests handlers
 45 		 * @private
 46 		 * @returns
 47 		 */
 48 		this.getReqHandlers = function getReqHandlers() {
 49 			return _reqHandlers;
 50 		};
 51 		
 52 		/**
 53 		 * Make a request
 54 		 * @param {String} channel is the name of the request handler to use
 55 		 * @param {Object} reqData the request data
 56 		 * @param {Function} callback the function to execute with the result
 57 		 * @param {Object} scope the scope in which to execute the callback
 58 		 * @returns
 59 		 */
 60 		this.request = function request(channel, reqData, callback, scope) {
 61 			if (_reqHandlers && _reqHandlers[channel] && typeof reqData == "object") {
 62 				_reqHandlers[channel](reqData, function () {
 63 					callback.apply(scope, arguments);
 64 				});
 65 				return true;
 66 			} else {
 67 				return false;
 68 			}
 69 		};
 70 		
 71 		/**
 72 		 * Listen to a path (Kept alive)
 73 		 * @param {String} channel is the name of the request handler to use
 74 		 * @param {String} url the url on which to listen
 75 		 * @param {Function} callback the function to execute with the result
 76 		 * @param {Object} scope the scope in which to execute the callback
 77 		 * @returns
 78 		 */
 79 		this.listen = function listen(channel, url, callback, scope) {
 80 			if (_reqHandlers && _reqHandlers[channel] &&
 81 				typeof url == "string" && typeof callback == "function") {
 82 				var func = function () {
 83 					callback.apply(scope, arguments);
 84 				},
 85 				reqData = {
 86 						keptAlive: true,
 87 						method: "get",
 88 						path: url
 89 				},
 90 				abort = _reqHandlers[channel](reqData, func, func);
 91 				return function () {
 92 					abort.func.call(abort.scope);
 93 				};
 94 			} else {
 95 				return false;
 96 			}
 97 		};
 98 		
 99 		this.setReqHandlers($reqHandlers);
100 		
101 	};
102 	
103 });
